intro: Udora cordofana, commonly known as the cordate udora, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in a range of colors, including pink, red, and white. Udora cordofana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate to flourish. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
